Package eea.engine.event.basicevents

This package provides a set of basic events for use in the eea framework.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
CollisionEvent This event checks if the entity owning the event has collided with a different entity
KeyDownEvent This event represents the user currently pressing ("down") a key on the keyboard
KeyPressedEvent This event represents the user has just released ("pressed") a key on the keyboard
LeavingScreenEvent This event represents cases where the owning entity of the event is just in the process of leaving (the displayable part of) the screen.
LoopEvent This special type of event ensures that the action(s) associated with the event will always occur, thus providing an "endless loop":
MouseClickedEvent This type of event will cause all associated action(s) to perform if the user has clicked the left mouse button.
MouseEnteredEvent This event represents cases where the mouse position matches the area occupied by the entity owning this event
MovementDoesNotCollideEvent This event represents cases where the movement of the entity owning the entity does not collide with any other entity
 

Package eea.engine.event.basicevents Description

This package provides a set of basic events for use in the eea framework. More precisely, the following events are provided, all of which override the inherited Event.performAction(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, int) method of class Event, and base their decision on the entity owning the concrete event

  • CollisionEvent checks if the owning entity has collided with a different, non-passable entity
  • KeyDownEvent acts if the key(s} passed in are currently pushed ("down")
  • KeyPressedEvent acts if the key(s) passed in have just been released ("pushed")
  • LeavingScreenEvent acts if the owning entity is off the visible screen area
  • LoopEvent will loop indefinitely
  • MouseClickedEvent will act if the left mouse button is just being pressed
  • MouseEnteredEvent acts if the mouse cursor is on top of the entity owning the event
  • MovementDoesNotCollideEvent acts only if the given movement will not lead to a collision.
